unnormalised: Environmental News: Renewable Energy Surges in Rajasthan
normalised: Environmental News: Renewable Energy Surges in Rajasthan

unnormalised: Rajasthan is really stepping up its green game! A new solar park, sprawling across 500 sq ft near Jodhpur, is set to power thousands of homes and businesses. Dr. Sharma, a lead scientist at IIT Delhi, hailed the project as a “game-changer” for India’s renewable energy goals.
normalised: Rajasthan is really stepping up its green game! A new solar park, sprawling across five hundred square feet near Jodhpur, is set to power thousands of homes and businesses. Doctor Sharma, a lead scientist at I I T Delhi, hailed the project as a “game-changer” for India’s renewable energy goals.

unnormalised: The Rajasthan Renewable Energy Corporation (RREC) estimates the park will reduce carbon emissions by a whopping 2 million tonnes annually. Plus, it's creating tons of local jobs!
normalised: The Rajasthan Renewable Energy Corporation (R R E C) estimates the park will reduce carbon emissions by a whopping two million tonnes annually. Plus, it's creating tons of local jobs!

unnormalised: This initiative comes as India aims to generate 500 GW of its electricity from non-fossil fuel sources by 2030. We’re talking major commitments, folks!
normalised: This initiative comes as India aims to generate five hundred G W of its electricity from non-fossil fuel sources by two thousand and thirty. We’re talking major commitments, folks!

unnormalised: The project, costing an estimated Rs. 2,500 Crore, also includes wind turbines and a small-scale biogas plant. Experts are saying that integrating traditional knowledge with modern tech, like using cow dung for biogas, is key to a sustainable future. Even Bollywood star, Deepika Padukone, has praised the initiative, calling it a “ray of hope” for future generations. Let's hope other states follow Rajasthan's lead!
normalised: The project, costing an estimated rupee two thousand five hundred crore, also includes wind turbines and a small-scale biogas plant. Experts are saying that integrating traditional knowledge with modern tech, like using cow dung for biogas, is key to a sustainable future. Even Bollywood star, Deepika Padukone, has praised the initiative, calling it a “ray of hope” for future generations. Let's hope other states follow Rajasthan's lead!
